ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Classic central profile with contralateral (left ear) deficits on dichotic tests and bilateral temporal processing deficits, consistent with right temporal lobe pathology.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right Temporal Lobe Glioblastoma Multiforme
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Known medical diagnosis; the tumor and surgical sequelae are the etiology of the central auditory deficits.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess speech recognition ability in quiet.
Evaluate binaural integration and hemispheric function.
Electrophysiological assessment of cortical auditory function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates a classic central auditory profile associated with right temporal lobe pathology. Peripheral hearing is normal in the left ear, while the right ear shows a mild conductive loss. Central testing reveals a marked contralateral (left ear) deficit on dichotic tasks and bilateral deficits on temporal processing. Electrophysiologically, late potentials are paradoxically larger over the lesioned hemisphere, likely due to a lack of inhibition, while the P300 is largely absent.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear thresholds normal. Right ear shows mild conductive hearing loss (low-frequency dip).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Excellent speech recognition (100%) bilaterally in quiet.

tests.name: Dichotic Speech Tests
tests.result_summary: Classic contralateral effect: Left ear scores markedly depressed on Dichotic Digits (~65%), Dichotic Rhyme, and Competing Sentences (~25%). Right ear scores normal.

tests.name: Duration Patterns Test
tests.result_summary: Scores bilaterally depressed, falling below the normal range.

tests.name: Late Potentials (N1, P2)
tests.result_summary: N1 and P2 waves present bilaterally at normal latencies but paradoxically larger and better defined over the lesioned (right) hemisphere.

tests.name: P300
tests.result_summary: Absent for all tracings, with the possible exception of the C3 tracing for the right ear.

proposed_items: Communication strategies for complex listening environments
counseling_actions: Explain the 'contralateral effect': difficulty hearing in the left ear is due to right brain processing issues, not the ear itself.
Discuss that the mild right ear conductive loss is likely unrelated to the brain tumor.
Advise on difficulties in noise or with multiple speakers due to dichotic deficits.

escalation.rationale_short: Report audiological findings consistent with known right temporal lobe pathology; patient is already under medical care.
